name: abrupt
content:
abrupt adjective
(SUDDEN)
Add to word list
Add to word list
C2 sudden and unexpected, and often unpleasant: abrupt end Our conversation came to an abrupt end when George burst into the room.abrupt change There was an abrupt change in her attitude towards me when she heard that I was Alan's girlfriendabrupt halt The car juddered and came to an abrupt halt in the middle of the road. The road ended in an abrupt (= sudden and very steep) slope down to the sea.
More examplesFewer examplesThe party came to rather an abrupt ending when Tom's parents came home.There was an abrupt fall in our sales figures following the bad publicity.As you step into the air-conditioned office, there is an abrupt change in temperature.
